body:
Now that it's not the middle of the night I decided to take a look at this; it appears that when composed fields are used in the parent structs metadata, their indexes are rewritten, but this was not done for xmlname fields (which are handled separately). This is a relatively easy fix ([CL](https://go-review.googlesource.com/#/c/25242/)).

I know it's scheduled for 1.8 and we're pretty far into the 1.7 release cycle, but it would be nice if this could be snuck in as it almost certainly won't cause problems and fixes some pretty bad behavior.
